alert.note: Alert for Bossier; Webster (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 30 at 1:05PM CST until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Louisiana... Bodcau Bayou At Bayou Bodcau Lake affecting Webster and Bossier Parishes. For the Bodcau Bayou...including Bayou Bodcau Lake...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Bodcau Bayou At Bayou Bodcau Lake. * WHEN...From this afternoon until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM CST Monday the stage was 172.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM CST Monday was 172.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 177.0 feet Wednesday. Additional rises are possible as additional rain is expected later this week. - Flood stage is 172.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 176.8 feet on 05/07/1964. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Do not drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For more hydrologic information, copy and paste the following website address into your favorite web browser URL bar: water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=shv The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 115 PM CST.
